abstract.p: Police sting operation in Queens ends with arrests of 22 people who were charged with being part of stolen-car racket (S)

block.p: A police sting in Queens ended yesterday with the arrests of 22 people who were charged with being part of a stolen-car racket, the authorities said.

For 13 months, detectives operated a fake chop shop on 157th Street in Jamaica, videotaping car owners and middlemen who wanted to sell automobiles surreptitiously and then report them stolen. Stolen cars were also stripped for parts at the shop, the police said.

Just after dawn yesterday, the police arrested 12 people who they said had arranged to defraud their insurance companies, and 10 others who worked as chop-shop employees or supervisors, according to Police Commissioner Howard Safir and Richard A. Brown, the Queens district attorney.
